org.flemil.ui
Interface Item

All Known Subinterfaces:
Scrollable, TextItem, Window
All Known Implementing Classes:
Button, CheckBox, ComboBox, DateField, Gauge, Grid, ImageItem, Label, List, Menu, MenuItem, Panel, PopUpWindow, RadioButton, ScreenWindow, ScrollBar, TabsControl, TextField
public interface Item

The interface that every component must implement for effective interaction with and manipulation by other components and display management utilities

Author:
Solomon Kariri

Method Detail

setParent

void setParent(Item parent)
Sets the parent for this Item which also have to be an Item. This reference to the parent will be used to provide features most of which is the scrolling callback to notify the parent container of a scrolling action.

Parameters:
parent - the Item in which this Item is placed. null if this Item is the topmost Item

getParent

Item getParent()
Returns the parent Item to this Item

Returns:
the parent Item to this Item

focusGained

void focusGained()
Called when this Item gains focus.

focusLost

void focusLost()
Called when this Item looses focus.

setDisplayRect

void setDisplayRect(Rectangle rect)
Sets the rectangle that is available on the display for the rendering of this component

Parameters:
rect - the Rectangle area available on the display for rendering of this Item

getDisplayRect

Rectangle getDisplayRect()
Returns the currently set displayRect for this Item

Returns:
the displayRect for this Item
See Also:
getMinimumDisplayRect(int), setDisplayRect(Rectangle)

getMinimumDisplayRect

Rectangle getMinimumDisplayRect(int availWidth)
Returns the minimum dimensions that this Item requires for visible display of its contents. A rectangle with a zero dimension implies no minimum limit in that dimension.

Parameters:
availWidth - the maximum available width that this Items rect can be allowed to occupy
Returns:
the minimum possible rectangle for usable operation of this Item.
See Also:
setDisplayRect(Rectangle), getDisplayRect()

repaint

void repaint(Rectangle clip)
Repaints the given region of this Item. Mostly all calls to this method will result in the propagation of the call to the parent of this Item until the bottom most Item is reached so that all Items whose displayRectanges are intersected by the repainted rectangles repaints the intersects as well

Parameters:
clip - the clip region that is to be repainted

paint

void paint(javax.microedition.lcdui.Graphics g,
           Rectangle clip)
Paints the region of this Item specified by the clip. The Item makes calculations to reduce as much as possible the area that is repainted for the Item. If the clip does not intersect in any way with this Items displayRectangle, then the Item is not painted at all.

Parameters:
g - the graphics on which the painting is to be done
clip - the region of the graphics that requires update or that is to be painted on by this Item

keyPressedEvent

void keyPressedEvent(int keyCode)
Invoked when a key is pressed when this Item is in focus. This method performs the necessary action for the key pressed.

Parameters:
keyCode - the key code as provided by the underlying native platform.

keyReleasedEvent

void keyReleasedEvent(int keyCode)
Invoked when a key is released when this Item is in focus. This method performs the necessary action for the key pressed.

Parameters:
keyCode - the key code as provided by the underlying native platform.

keyPressedEventReturned

void keyPressedEventReturned(int keyCode)
Invoked by a child of this Item if it cannot handle a keyPressed event passed to it. The parent then deals with the event if it can or propagates it to its parent if any if it cannot handle it.

Parameters:
keyCode - the key code as provided by the underlying native platform.

keyReleasedEventReturned

void keyReleasedEventReturned(int keyCode)
Invoked by a child of this Item if it cannot handle a keyReleased event passed to it. The parent then deals with the event if it can or propagates it to its parent if any if it cannot handle it.

Parameters:
keyCode - the key code as provided by the underlying native platform.

keyRepeatedEvent

void keyRepeatedEvent(int keyCode)
Invoked when a key is repeated i.e. pressed and held down, when this Item is in focus. This method performs the necessary action for the key repeated.

Parameters:
keyCode - the key code as provided by the underlying native platform.

keyRepeatedEventReturned

void keyRepeatedEventReturned(int keyCode)
Invoked by a child of this Item if it cannot handle a keyRepeated event passed to it. The parent then deals with the event if it can or propagates it to its parent if any if it cannot handle it.

Parameters:
keyCode - the key code as provided by the underlying native platform.

pointerPressedEventReturned

void pointerPressedEventReturned(int x,
                                 int y)
Invoked by a child of this Item if it cannot handle a pointerPressed event passed to it. The parent then deals with the event if it can or propagates it to its parent if any if it cannot handle it. The coordinates are relative to the whole display area of the application

Parameters:
x - the x coordinate of the pointer
y - the y coordinate of the pointer

pointerReleasedEventReturned

void pointerReleasedEventReturned(int x,
                                  int y)
Invoked by a child of this Item if it cannot handle a pointerReleased event passed to it. The parent then deals with the event if it can or propagates it to its parent if any if it cannot handle it. The coordinates are relative to the whole display area of the application

Parameters:
x - the x coordinate of the pointer
y - the y coordinate of the pointer

pointerDraggedEventReturned

void pointerDraggedEventReturned(int x,
                                 int y)
Invoked by a child of this Item if it cannot handle a pointerDragged event passed to it. The parent then deals with the event if it can or propagates it to its parent if any if it cannot handle it. The coordinates are relative to the whole display area of the application and not this Item. To know whether the coordinate falls within its displayRect it can call the Rectangle.contains() method with the coordinates as the parameters.

Parameters:
x - the x coordinate of the pointer
y - the y coordinate of the pointer
See Also:
getDisplayRect()

pointerPressedEvent

void pointerPressedEvent(int x,
                         int y)
Called in a device that supports a pointer. This method provides the location information for the pointer when it is pressed. The coordinates are relative to the whole display area of the application

Parameters:
x - the x coordinate of the pointer
y - the y coordinate of the pointer

pointerReleasedEvent

void pointerReleasedEvent(int x,
                          int y)
Called in a device that supports a pointer. This method provides the location information for the pointer when it is released. The coordinates are relative to the whole display area of the application

Parameters:
x - the x coordinate of the pointer
y - the y coordinate of the pointer

pointerDraggedEvent

void pointerDraggedEvent(int x,
                         int y)
Called in a device that supports a pointer. This method provides the location information for the pointer when it is dragged. The coordinates are relative to the whole display area of the application

Parameters:
x - the x coordinate of the pointer
y - the y coordinate of the pointer

setPaintBorder

void setPaintBorder(boolean paint)
Used to specify whether this Item should paint its border or not. If set true the Item will paint its border and not otherwise. All borders are painted one pixel wide and might be rounded at the edges depending on the Style settings of the application

Parameters:
paint - sets whether this Item should paint its border.

isPaintBorder

boolean isPaintBorder()
Returns whether this Item paints its border

Returns:
true if paints border and false otherwise
See Also:
paint(Graphics, Rectangle)

isFocusible

boolean isFocusible()
Checks whether this Item can be set as the currently focused Item. This means that this Item should be able to adjust its behavior or look and feel in response to calls to its focusGained() or focusLost() methods

Returns:
true if can be focused and false otherwise
See Also:
focusGained(), focusLost()

setFocusible

void setFocusible(boolean focusible)
Sets whether this Item should be focusable. This if passed the value true, then this Item will change its effects when being drawn to respond to focus gain and focus loss events

Parameters:
focusible -
See Also:
focusGained(), focusLost()

isFocussed

boolean isFocussed()
